excerpt: Huge outdoor water park with slides & games for all ages, plus food outlets & picnic areas.
detail_description: Aqualandia, located in Benidorm, Costa Blanca, Spain, is a sprawling outdoor water park offering an array of slides and games suitable for visitors of all ages. The park features fast water slides, swimming pools, rapids, giant waterfalls, and shallow pools for young children. Additionally, it includes various dining options, shops, and relaxation areas for sunbathing. Aqualandia is the perfect destination to beat the summer heat with its diverse attractions and amenities.
name: Aqualandia
address: Sierra Helada, s/n, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Poniente Beach in Benidorm is a must-visit spot, especially if you're exploring the city. It's a great place to relax, sunbathe, and take a dip in the inviting waters of Alicante. The beach offers a more tranquil atmosphere compared to Levante Beach and is perfect for spending a leisurely afternoon. Additionally, nearby attractions like the Cross of Benidorm provide stunning panoramic views of the city.
name: Poniente Beach (Cervecería & Coctelería)
address: Av. de la Armada Española, 5, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Levante Beach & Paseo Maritimo At 100mts is a must-visit spot in Benidorm, especially during the summer. Despite the crowds, there are still quiet spots to enjoy the sun and sea. The beautiful beach offers great opportunities for walking, sunbathing, and paddling in the sea. Additionally, the magnificent promenade provides good views and an extraordinary experience for visitors.
name: Levante Beach & Paseo Maritimo At 100mts
address: C. Gerona, 22, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: The busy, whitewashed Old Town rises to castle ruins at the Balcó del Mediterrani, with views over the port and flanking beaches. The same hilltop is marked by the iconic blue-tiled dome of 18th-century Saint James Church, set in a plaza with open-air cafes, while buzzing nightlife on inland streets encompasses LGBTQ bars and discos. Tavern-style restaurants specialize in Valencian paella and Mediterannean seafood.
detail_description: Old Town Benidorm, also known as the Old Quarter (Parte Vieja), is a bustling area with a whitewashed charm and historic allure. Perched on a hill, it offers stunning views of the port and beaches, along with castle ruins at Balcó del Mediterrani. The iconic blue-tiled dome of 18th-century Saint James Church stands in a plaza surrounded by open-air cafes, while the inland streets come alive at night with LGBTQ bars and discos.
name: Old Town
address: Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Benidorm Palace has become a popular attraction, especially after being featured in the ITV comedy series 'Benidorm.' The venue has been hosting live shows and events for almost 40 years, featuring internationally renowned artists such as Julio Iglesias and Alejandro Sanz. Visitors can enjoy high-quality performances, stunning costumes, and great music while indulging in delicious food.
name: Benidorm Palace
address: Av. Dr. Severo Ochoa, 13, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Dolphin shows & swimming with sea lions, plus meerkats & monkeys in tropically themed sea-life park.
detail_description: Mundomar is a sea-life park in Benidorm, offering a tropical-themed experience with various attractions. Visitors can enjoy dolphin shows, swim with sea lions, and interact with meerkats and monkeys. The park provides an opportunity to get up close to marine animals like dolphins and seals without the need for an expensive cruise. Mundomar also features entertaining shows and a glass bottom boat ride for a memorable experience.
name: Mundomar
address: Carrer Serra Gelada, s/n, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Hilltop marked by a huge cross, accessible by hiking or driving, with views of Benidorm & the sea.
detail_description: La Cruz de Benidorm is a prominent hilltop marked by a large cross, accessible either by hiking or driving. The site offers breathtaking views of Benidorm and the sea. It's located about 4 kilometers east of Benidorm and can be reached via a half-hour hike. The walk takes approximately 45 minutes with a reasonably steep gradient, but the stunning panoramic view from the top makes it worthwhile, especially during sunrise or sunset.
name: La Cruz de Benidorm
address: C. Taywan, 14, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Benidorm is a seaside resort on the eastern coast of Spain, part of the Valencia region’s famed Costa Blanca. A tiny fishing village till the 1960s, it’s now a popular Mediterranean holiday destination known for its nightlife. Its 2 wide sandy beaches, Levante Beach and Poniente Beach, are backed by palm-lined promenades, bars and rows of skyscrapers.
detail_description: Benidorm, located on the eastern coast of Spain, is a renowned seaside resort in the Valencia region's Costa Blanca. Once a small fishing village, it has transformed into a popular Mediterranean holiday destination celebrated for its vibrant nightlife. The area boasts two expansive sandy beaches, Levante Beach and Poniente Beach, bordered by palm-lined promenades and towering skyscrapers.
name: Benidorm
address: Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Tranquil, rocky cove known for its clear, placid waters, rustic terrain & sweeping views.
detail_description: Cala Tio Ximo is a serene and secluded rocky cove with calm, crystal-clear waters and stunning panoramic views. It can be accessed via a paved road from Levante Beach, leading to a picturesque route passing by ocher mines characteristic of the area. The surrounding terrain offers a rustic charm, with the option to continue the journey towards Punta del Cavall for breathtaking vistas of Sierra Helada cliffs and nearby Island Mitjana.
name: Cala Tio Ximo
address: C. Dos Calas, 106, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Lofty waterfront promontory with Roman ruins & a viewpoint overlooking Benidorm & the sea.
detail_description: Tossal de la Cala, also known as Mirador de la Cala, is a remarkable waterfront promontory in Benidorm offering stunning panoramic views of the Mediterranean Sea and the surrounding area. This lookout point sits atop a hill and provides visitors with an unparalleled vantage point to admire the beautiful landscape, including the nearby fishing village of Altea. The site also features Roman ruins, adding an archaeological dimension to its allure.
name: Tossal de la cala
address: C/ de la Ermita, 1, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Tiny, sheltered inlet with a sandy shoreline, plus a waterfront promenade & foot showers.
detail_description: Platgeta del Mal Pas is a small, secluded inlet nestled between the Levante and Poniente beaches in Benidorm's old town. It offers a sandy shoreline, a waterfront promenade, and foot showers for visitors. Opposite the cove lies Benidorm Island, home to an important marine reserve that attracts divers with its excellent sea beds. Accessible from the city's marina, this cove provides stunning views of the surrounding beaches and the geyser.
name: Platgeta del Mal Pas
address: Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Plaça del Castell is a charming terrace located at the promontory between two beaches in Benidorm. It stands on the site of the former Benidorm castle, offering stunning panoramic views of the surrounding area. Visitors can enjoy the sun-soaked vistas while sipping on refreshing sangria from nearby bars. The tranquil spot with beautiful stone steps and pillars provides an ideal setting to relax and witness breathtaking sunsets over Benidorm's beaches and the Mediterranean Sea.
name: Plaça del Castell
address: Pl. de Sta. Ana, 1, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Low Festival, held at the end of July, is a treasure trove for fans of alternative guitar pop and dance music. The festival offers a friendly atmosphere with a focus on Spanish music and also features some international acts. It takes place in the city's football stadium and is easily accessible by bus. However, there have been concerns about overcrowding, so organizers are urged to control capacity and provide more shade and water fountains to combat the heat.
name: Low Festival
address: Av. Ciudad Deportiva, 17, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Small amusement park featuring old-school kiddie rides & an arcade with redemption games & prizes.
detail_description: Sould Park Festilandia Benidorm is a small amusement park located in the center of Avenue Mediterraneo, offering traditional kiddie rides and arcade games. It's a nostalgic experience for adults and great fun for kids. The park features simple rides, redemption games, hot dogs, candy floss, and mini-golf. Visitors can purchase a top-up card to access the attractions easily. Recently renovated with modern facilities, it offers an indoor area with various games and machines.
name: Sould Park Festilandia Benidorm - Parc Infantil i d'Atraccions
address: Av. del Mediterráneo, 20, bajo, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Meeting point at a lookout deck with white-stone balustrades, known for beach, town & sunset views.
detail_description: Mirador del Castell - Balcó de la Mediterrània is a must-visit lookout deck with white-stone balustrades, offering breathtaking views of the beach, town, and stunning sunsets. The castle's remaining walls provide a historical touch to this spot, perched on top of the rock overlooking the sea. Known as The Balcony of the Mediterranean, it offers spectacular panoramic views along the coastline and Benidorm's skyline.
name: Mediterranean Balcony
address: Plaça de Castelar, 1, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Restaurante Tapas Alley, also known as Calle Santo Domingo in Benidorm's Old Town, is a vibrant hub filled with bars offering traditional Spanish dishes like patatas bravas and gambas al pil pil. This area provides a contrast to the international cuisine found along the seafront promenade. Tourists can savor an authentic taste of Spanish delicacies while strolling through the covered streets lined with numerous tapas bars.
name: Tapas alley
address: C. de Santo Domingo, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Catholic church from the 1700s, with a recently added pipe organ & religious festivities.
detail_description: Església de Sant Jaume i Santa Anna, also known as St. James and St. Anne's Church, is a stunning Catholic church located in the heart of Benidorm's old town. The snow-white building with blue domes dates back to the 18th century and stands on the hill of Canfali, where a small fortress once stood. The church is active and hosts regular Catholic masses.
name: Església de Sant Jaume i Santa Anna
address: Plaça de Castelar, 1, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Popular public beach in a protected rocky cove near restaurants, cafes & a tiki bar.
detail_description: Platja de La Cala de Finestrat is a popular public beach located in a protected rocky cove near restaurants, cafes, and a tiki bar. It is considered one of the most beautiful beaches in Benidorm and offers a quieter bathing experience due to its hidden location between two main beaches. The cove stretches for over 300 meters with fine golden sand and calm, crystal-clear waters.
name: Platja de La Cala de Finestrat
address: Av. Marina Baixa, s/n, 03509 Finestrat, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: The Benidorm Indoor Market is a large, reasonably priced clothes store that is not too busy. There are places selling accessories and jewellery as well. The best part of the market is the small cafe bar by the Money Exchange that does a very good English breakfast.
name: Benidorm Indoor Market MERCALOIX
address: Av. Ametlla de Mar, 9, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Museo Boca del Calvari is a captivating museum in downtown Benidorm that showcases a diverse collection of local artifacts, including archaeological remains, traditional crafts, tools, and rare items linked to the region's fishing industry. The museum features an array of displays such as photos, sculptures, paintings, and ancient coins that offer insights into the city's history. Visitors can also explore changing exhibitions that delve into various aspects of Benidorm's past.
name: Museo Boca del Calvari
address: C/ de Tomàs Ortuño, s/n, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: The Intempo Building in Benidorm is a prominent feature of the city's skyline, with its 192-meter height and 47 floors making it the tallest building in the area. Situated on Avenida Colombia, this architectural gem stands out for its impressive design. The building offers luxurious accommodations such as the beachfront 2-bedroom Intempocarrera - Apartment At Intempo Building, which features an infinity swimming pool.
name: Intempo Building
address: Av. de Mejico, 7, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Restaurante La Falúa Café Pub, established in 2007, has become a renowned dining destination in Benidorm. It offers a blend of Mediterranean and international cuisine as well as traditional gastronomy. The restaurant prides itself on constantly innovating its creations using fresh, high-quality ingredients to provide a delightful culinary experience.
name: La Falúa
address: C. Santander, 22, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Classic tapas, rice dishes & daily menus at a lively stop with hanging hams & seats at the counter.
detail_description: La Cava Aragonesa is a classic tapas bar located in the heart of Benidorm's Old Town. It is known for its lively atmosphere and traditional Spanish dishes. The bar offers a wide variety of tapas, including Yescas, Catalan-style toasted bread with olive oil and tomato, prepared with over 100 varieties of cold meats, cheeses, and salted fish.
name: La Cava Aragonesa
address: Pl. de la Constitució, 2, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Racó de l'Oix, also known as Rincon de Loix, is a popular area in Benidorm, particularly favored by tourists. This neighborhood boasts numerous dining options ranging from noodle bars and seafood restaurants to fast-food outlets and bars serving 'pub grub'. The competition keeps prices extremely affordable, even in prime waterfront locations. The eastern side of Levante features a high concentration of high-rise buildings, hotels, apartments, and villas.
name: Racó de l'Oix
address: 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Parasailing Benidorm offers an unforgettable and highly recommended experience, with excellent organization and staff. Booking is super easy, and the treatment upon arrival is excellent. The instructors are amazing, making the whole experience enjoyable. People who have tried it describe it as a brutal but exciting experience with friendly staff. Many visitors express their desire to repeat the activity due to its thrilling nature and recommend it to others without hesitation.
name: Parasailing Benidorm
address: caseta 2, Pg. de Colón, 2, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: If you're looking for a taste of the Wild West while soaking up the sun in Benidorm, look no further than Western Saloon. Nestled within the Hotel Ambassador Playa, this vibrant bar is hard to miss with its towering cactus and fluttering American flags. Open until 4am every night, it promises an electrifying atmosphere filled with live music that spans genres from country to rock and roll.
name: Western Saloon
address: C. Gerona, 39, 41, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: The Mirador de Sant Jaume overlooks the city of Barcelona and offers spectacular views of the Mediterranean Sea. The spot is popular for its panoramic views and is a popular tourist destination.
name: Mirador de Sant Jaume
address: Plaça de Sant Jaume, 4, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Karting Benidorm offers an easy and fun racing experience at a good price, with helpful and friendly staff. The track is within walking distance of the town and has a bar and food available. It's suitable for families or groups, with single and double karts available. While the karts may not be the fastest, they still provide an exciting ride. Visitors can enjoy pitting in their own groups for a more personalized experience.
name: Karting Benidorm
address: Av. de la Comunitat Valenciana, s/n, KM. 121, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Located between the popular beaches of Ti Ximo and La Almadrava in Benidorm, Cró. del Mal Pas is a serene cove with soft sand, close to the historic area and the port. This secluded spot offers a peaceful escape from the bustling town center, making it an ideal location for activities such as scuba diving and snorkeling along its stunning rocky seabed.
name: Cró. del Mal Pas
address: 03501 Benidorm, Alacant, Spain

detail_description: Parc de L’Aigüera, situated in the center of Benidorm, is a charming park ideal for leisurely walks and enjoyable family outings. The park offers various attractions such as a mini-zoo, multiple playgrounds, and several scenic walking paths. Visitors can also admire a lovely lake teeming with diverse waterfowl like flamingos, ducks, and swans. It is considered the largest green space in downtown Benidorm.
name: Parc de L’Aigüera
address: Av. L'Aigüera, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Urban public beach with recreational waters, lifeguards, showers, lounge chairs & volleyball nets.
detail_description: Platja de Llevant is an urban public beach in Benidorm, known for its recreational waters, lifeguards, showers, lounge chairs, and volleyball nets. Despite not having the quaint charm of a secluded cove, it is a beloved Blue Flag bay with golden shores and crystal-clear waters. This popular beach offers a bustling atmosphere and stunning views of the Mediterranean sea. During peak season, it can get crowded as visitors flock to enjoy the gentle waves and clean sandy shores.
name: Platja de Llevant
address: Spain

detail_description: Vincents Old Town Benidorm is a charming area in the heart of Benidorm, known for its picturesque streets and squares offering a variety of dining and drinking options. The old town center provides a pleasant stroll, especially in the cooler evenings. Visitors can explore Esglesia de Sant Jaume Santa Anna, an ancient church located within the old center.
name: Vincents Old Town Benidorm
address: Av. de los Almendros, 8, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Urban shoreline with sand & palm trees, plus lifeguards, toilet facilities & a restaurant.
detail_description: West Beach Promenade, also known as Playa del Mal Pas, is a serene urban shoreline nestled between two lively main beaches in Benidorm. This hidden gem offers a quieter bathing experience with lifeguards, toilet facilities, and a restaurant nearby. The picturesque ambience includes tall palm trees and views of the Esglesia de Sant Jaume Santa Anna church in the old town. Visitors can enjoy dining at various restaurants along the promenade with outdoor terraces overlooking the Mediterranean Sea.
name: West Beach Promenade
address: Spain

detail_description: Centro Comercial La Marina is a large, popular shopping mall in Benidorm. It has a wide range of stores, including Zara and H&M, as well as McDonalds and other food outlets. It is definitely worth a visit if you're looking for something to do in the area.
name: Centro Comercial La Marina
address: Avinguda País Valencià, 2, 03509 Finestrat, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: The Maritime Cultural Center, along with its various clubs and activities, serves as a hub for cultural engagement. This center is a dedicated space where individuals can immerse themselves in the diverse offerings of art, music, and literature. It provides a platform for artists and enthusiasts to showcase their talents through exhibitions, performances, and workshops. The center fosters creativity and encourages collaboration among members of the community who share similar interests.
name: Centre Cultural Maritim
address: Pg. de Colón, 7, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

name: Cable Ski BENIDORM
address: Av. de Madrid, 33, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Port Esportiu de Benidorm is a historic and bustling port that has evolved over the years. Initially a fishing town without its own port, it saw significant development in the 20th century. The port is particularly lively during the summer months, with boats ferrying visitors to Benidorm Island and Calpi, as well as offering activities like parachute rides and jet skiing.
name: Port Esportiu de Benidorm
address: Pg. de Colón, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Restaurante 'Llum del Mar' is a must-visit in Benidorm, offering a tantalizing menu inspired by the Mediterranean. Situated in the heart of the city, it provides stunning views and mouthwatering cuisine. The warm ambiance and Med-inspired decor create a tranquil oasis away from the bustling city life. Known for its exquisite seafood and fine dining experience, this restaurant offers an ideal setting for a romantic evening overlooking Benidorm's coastline.
name: Restaurante 'Llum del Mar'
address: Plaça de Sant Jaume, 1, 03500 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Seafood & traditional Mediterranean dishes in a modern space with pale wood decor & framed photos.
detail_description: Ducado is a traditional down-home cooking restaurant with a rustic yet modern feel. The atmosphere is welcoming and the food is delicious. The kitchen staff are skilled in creating classic dishes using fresh, local ingredients.
name: Restaurante Ducado
address: Av. de Almería, s/n, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

name: Restaurante Jardín Mediterráneo
address: Avinguda Alcoi, 17, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Nestled along the stunning seafront of Platja de Ponent, Amigos Bistro by Nas & Dino is a delightful culinary gem that has been charming visitors since its inception in 2011. This inviting eatery offers a fantastic blend of fresh seafood and traditional Spanish tapas, all served in an atmosphere brimming with warmth and hospitality.
name: Amigos Bistro
address: Av. de la Armada Española, 19, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Cala del Mal Pas is a small cove located between Benidorm Old Town and Poniente Beach. It's about 120 meters long, making it one of the smaller beaches in the area. The beach is known for its clear waters and lack of rocks, making it ideal for swimming. While it can get busy, there are facilities nearby and loungers available for hire. The beach offers a true Spanish experience with a mix of local culture and holiday vibes.
name: Cala del Mal Pas
address: Pg. de Colón, 2, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Restaurante Aitona, situated at Avenida Ruzafa 2, is a highly recommended establishment for those seeking to indulge in delightful regional and Spanish cuisine at reasonable prices. They offer satisfactory paellas and fideuas that are worth trying. Reserving beforehand is advisable due to its popularity, particularly during the summer months. This Spanish restaurant, located in Benidorm's southern region, boasts an array of authentic dishes from Spain as well as Italy, Greece, and Morocco.
name: Restaurant Aitona
address: Av. de Ruzafa, 2, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Benidorm Train Vision is a tourist attraction that takes visitors around the Levante beach area. It is great for children and is a fun way to see what Benidorm has to offer. The train lasts around 50 minutes and is a great way to get around the city.
name: Benidorm Train Vision
address: Av. del Mediterráneo, 43, 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Cala Almadraba is a stunning cove located near Tio Ximo Cove, at the northern coast of Benidorm. Nestled at the foot of Sierra Helada and surrounded by cliffs, this 100-meter long cove features crystal-clear waters, fine sand, and rocks. It's a popular spot for scuba diving and snorkeling due to its beautiful rocky seabed and calm waters.
name: Cala Almadraba
address: Mar Mediterráneo, 03503, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Ancient culture-themed areas in amusement park with white-knuckle & family rides, plus shows.
detail_description: Terra Mítica is an amusement park in Benidorm, Alicante, featuring ancient culture-themed areas with thrilling rides and entertaining shows. The park is divided into five themed zones such as Greece, Egypt, and Rome, offering attractions for both adrenaline seekers and families. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views of Benidorm due to the park's hillside location. Additionally, Terra Mítica provides a respite from the heat with its water rides.
name: Terra Mítica
address: Partida del Moralet, s/n, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

name: Parc de Calistènia Platja de Ponent
address: Av. Vicente Llorca Alós, 23, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Animal zoo with elephants, sea lions & pony rides, plus seasonal water park with pools & slides.
detail_description: Terra Natura is a remarkable zoo that features elephants, sea lions, and pony rides. Additionally, it has a seasonal water park with various pools and slides. This zoo is well-maintained as all the enclosures are in excellent condition which makes it feel like the animals are within reach. The walk-through aviary is an amazing experience, with mist sprays that make it feel unique. It's both compact and spacious simultaneously making it an ideal place for children to visit.
name: Terra Natura
address: Foia del Verdader, 1, 03502 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Modest park featuring a fountain & multiple park benches surrounded by palm trees.
detail_description: The Parc d'Elx is a large, open-air park in the centre of Elx, near the beach. It has a fountain, several benches, and palm trees. There is a playground for children, as well as training equipment for athletes. There are many restaurants and shops nearby, making it an ideal spot to spend a day out.
name: Parc d'Elx
address: C. del Alcalde José Such Ortega, 03501 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Rotonda del Rincón de Loix is a charming area with a great cafe and herbal shop called "la ventana natural" offering vitamins, supplements, and protein powders. The friendly staff provides discounts and freebies for larger purchases. Nearby bazaar shops offer quality items at affordable prices. Visitors can enjoy a peaceful walk along the beachfront, admiring the beautiful sea and enjoying the sunset. The hot sand, water, days, and nights make it an ideal place to relax and unwind.
name: Rotonda del Rincón de Loix
address: 03503 Benidorm, Alicante, Spain
